title: WCAS JWSH_ST 101-6-21 First-Year Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will offer an introductory sociological analysis of Israeli society and culture with an emphasis on the country's ethnic and religious composition (1990 to the present) and on the central components that shape Israeli collective identity. We will cover topics such as the secular and religious divide, waves of immigration to Israel, the socializing role of the military in Israeli life, as well as the long lasting impact of the holocaust and the Arab-Israeli conflict on Israeli society.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will gain a basic understanding of Israeli society and culture with an emphasis on the country's ethnic and religious composition (1990 to the present) and on the central components that shape Israeli collective identity.
